titleStmt.title: An act which His Maiesty hath promised his royall word to passe for justifying the proceedings of Parliament in the late war, and for declaring all oathes, declarations, proclamations, and other proceedings against it to be void.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

notesStmt.note: At head of title: New port September 23, 1648.
"Agreed on between His Majesty and the commissioners at Newport in the Isle of Wight."
Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
